required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Anastrozole Verses Clomiphene Citrate in Stimulating Follicular Growth and Ovulation in Infertile Women With Ovulatory Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Dose Finding, Comparative Study for the Evaluation of the Aromatase Inhibitor Anastrozole (Multiple-Dose) Versus Clomiphene Citrate in Stimulating Follicular Growth and Ovulation in Infertile Women With Ovulatory Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate and compare the safety and efficacy of various doses of the aromatase inhibitor (anastrozole) versus clomiphene citrate in stimulating follicular growth and ovulation in infertile women with ovulatory dysfunction.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Ovulation rate was defined as the percentage of subjects who ovulated (mid-luteal Progesteron [P4] level greater than or equal to [>=] 10 nanogram per milliliter [ng/mL] and/or pregnancy).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Clinical Pregnancy in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical pregnancy was defined as the existence of at least one ultrasonographically confirmed gestational sac in the uterus with fetal heart activity.

intervention.description: Subjects will be administered orally with 1 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month).
Subjects will be administered orally with 5 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month).
Subjects will be administered orally with 10 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month).
Subjects will be administered orally with 50 mg of clomiphene citrate once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month).
Subjects will be administered orally with 100 mg of clomiphene citrate once daily for 5 days in Cycle 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18-40 years
- Ovulatory dysfunction characterized by irregular and/or extended cycles
- Non-smoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previous gonadotropin treatment
- No more than 6 previous clomiphene treatment cycles

overall_official.affiliation: EMD Serono Inc., a business of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

group.title: Clomiphene Citrate 50 Milligram (mg)
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 50 mg of clomiphene citrate once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Clomiphene Citrate 50 mg or moved to Clomiphene Citrate 100 mg arm.

group.title: Clomiphene Citrate 100 mg
group.description: Subjects from Clomiphene Citrate 50 mg arm who were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and were administered orally with 100 mg of clomiphene citrate once daily for 5 days in Cycle 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month) were presented.

group.title: Anastrozole 1 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 1 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Anastrozole 1 mg or moved to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Anastrozole 5 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 5 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Anastrozole 5 mg or moved to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Anastrozole 10 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 10 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Some of the subjects from Anastrozole 1 mg and 5 mg arms were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Clomiphene Citrate 50 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 50 mg of clomiphene citrate once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Clomiphene Citrate 50 mg or moved to Clomiphene Citrate 100 mg arm.

group.title: Anastrozole 1 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 1 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Anastrozole 1 mg or moved to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Anastrozole 5 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 5 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Subjects in this arm were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 and either continued receiving Anastrozole 5 mg or moved to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Anastrozole 10 mg
group.description: Subjects were administered orally with 10 mg of anastrozole once daily for 5 days in Cycle 1, 2 and 3 (each cycle = approximately 1 month). Some of the subjects from Anastrozole 1 mg and 5 mg arms were re-randomized at the start of Cycle 2 and Cycle 3 to Anastrozole 10 mg arm.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Ovulation Rate in Cycle 1
outcome.description: Ovulation rate was defined as the percentage of subjects who ovulated (mid-luteal Progesteron [P4] level greater than or equal to [>=] 10 nanogram per milliliter [ng/mL] and/or pregnancy).
outcome.population: All Treated population included all treated subjects who received at least one tablet of study drug (clomiphene citrate or anastrozole).

outcome.description: Clinical pregnancy was defined as the existence of at least one ultrasonographically confirmed gestational sac in the uterus with fetal heart activity.
